thread.title: Agents join forces to rescue an island cat on his last legs
thread.title_full: Agents join forces to rescue an island cat on his last legs

title: Agents join forces to rescue an island cat on his last legs
text:
Agents join forces to rescue an island cat on his last legs 5 August 2015 Save 
﻿The trade was feline generous at the Yorkshire Travel Ball when it rallied round an agent looking to raise funds to rescue a stray cat from the Greek island of Crete. 
Sandy Murray of Sandy’s Travel Escapes raised £230 at the event last month towards a total of more than £550 needed to bring home “Tiger”. 
Murray, who is a regular visitor to Crete, said she was concerned for his welfare after the island suffered a tough winter last year and he had to have one of his eyes removed after an accident involving a grass seed. 
“Tiger used to just come and sit on the balcony in the apartment and he was a nice, lovely cat; he didn’t scarper off as soon as you went near him. I just thought: ‘If he doesn’t get looked after, he’s not going to last.’” 
Alongside raising £3,000 for charities including Reuben’s Retreat, the Greek Cats Welfare Society, the Soi Dog Foundation and Hull Greyhound Rescue, Murray also appealed to people to give their loose change to help her rescue Tiger. 
“I put a picture of Tiger and his little story on an envelope, and I said if you’ve got any change, just stick it inside,” she said. 
Murray is now aiming to head to Crete in September to bring Tiger back to the UK, where he will join her three other cats.
